page.title: 01General Description
page.content: Our particular area is mainly agricultural farmland,with a few areas of deciduos woodland.To the North West, in the valley of the river Pang, lies part of the village of Compton with a population of approximately 2,500.Here there is a primary school and a small comprehensive school serving all the local villages.Close by the primary school can be seen the route of the railway which once ran from Didcot to Southampton.In the North East lies Aldworth,a small rural village of approximately 500 people.The rest of the area has a scatterd population. Race horses are trained on some of the many cart_tracks crossing the chalk downland. Other places of interest include an old second world war airfield,two old churches and two playing fields.
